recommendations: Defer contrast-enhanced CT until STAT renal function labs (eGFR, creatinine, BUN, potassium) with timestamps are available. If the indication is non-emergent, consider non-contrast CT or MRI without gadolinium.

If the indication is emergent and renal labs are obtained, verify eGFR >= 30 mL/min/1.73m² before contrast. For eGFR 30-60, utilize low-dose or split-bolus protocols and adhere to KDIGO hydration guidelines.

protocol_selection.name: Liver Lesion Characterization (LI-RADS Multiphase)
protocol_selection.description: Includes non-contrast, arterial, portal venous, and delayed phases as per LI-RADS.
protocol_selection.contrast_timing: Arterial (≈35 sec), portal venous (≈70–80 sec), delayed (3–4 min).
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: As per abdomen protocol; adjust in renal impairment.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Consider MRI in patients with eGFR <30; use hydration and dose adjustment.

protocol_selection.name: Trauma CT – Chest, Abdomen & Pelvis with Contrast
protocol_selection.description: Contrast CT of torso with trauma-focused reformats; may include delayed images as needed.
protocol_selection.contrast_timing: Portal venous phase, possible delayed imaging to assess hemorrhage.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Standard contrast dose; trauma protocols may include split bolus techniques.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Minimize field-of-view and dose; use alternative imaging if stable and renal risk high.
